intro: Kedrostis angulata, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Kedrostis angulata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
